page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There are no ancient monuments,but there are quite a number of old houses,some going back to the 16th century,but one in particular,Nurstead Court,dates,in part,from at least the 14th century and parts of it might be older. There is no Parish Museum. There might be a possible site of a mill in 1240,the site of a Roman farm and a field where General Fairfax camped with his troops on the way to Maidstone during the Civil War. Meopham is almost certainly derived from one Meapaa (Saxon).Luddesdown comes from the Old English Hludesdun.Sole Street comes from the Old English Sol A Pond.
